wikipedia_page.main: Colonel Josiah Clement Wedgwood, 1st Baron Wedgwood,  (16 March 1872 – 26 July 1943), sometimes referred to as Josiah Wedgwood IV, was a British Liberal and Labour politician who served in government under Ramsay MacDonald. He was a prominent single-tax activist following the political-economic reformer Henry George.  He was the great-great-grandson of the famous potter Josiah Wedgwood.
